greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The number of permutations of {1,2,...,n,1,2,...,n} with the property that there are k numbers between the two k's in the set for k=1,...,n.
link: Ali Assarpour, Amotz Bar-Noy, Ou Liuo, Counting the Number of Langford Skolem Pairings, arXiv:1507.00315 [cs.DM], 2015.
example: a(1)=0; a(2)=0; a(3)=a(4)=2 since {{2,3,1,2,1,3},{3,1,2,1,3,2}} and {{4,1,3,1,2,4,3,2},{2,3,4,2,1,3,1,4}} are the only ways to permute {1,2,3,1,2,3} and {1,2,3,4,1,2,3,4}, respectively, such that there is one number between the 1's, two numbers between the 2's,..., n numbers between the n's.
program: (Sage) a=lambda n:sum(1 for i in DLXCPP([(i-1,j+n,i+j+n+1)for i in[1..n]for j in[0..n+n-i-2]]+[(i,)for i in[n..n+n-1]]))if n%4 in[0,3] else 0
results.author: _Andrew McFarland_, Apr 09 2010
ext: Edited and more terms added from A014552 by _Max Alekseyev_, May 31 2011, May 19 2015
Corrected and extended using results from the Assarpour et al. (2015) paper by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 22 2016 at the suggestion of _William Rex Marshall_.
